repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
fixes #15034 

Problem:
* Wording of `getcwd()` docs does not reflect well how to get the global working directory.
* There is a deviation from how Vim and Neovim use `getcwd()`.

Solution:
* Use global keyword where necessary.
* Make note of deviation from Vim.

comment_data.body: This is not equivalent to the below when 'autochdir' is applied.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3591,19 +3591,21 @@ getcursorcharpos([{winid}])                                 *getcursorcharpos()*
                   (`any`)
 
 getcwd([{winnr} [, {tabnr}]])                                         *getcwd()*
-		With no arguments, returns the name of the effective
-		|current-directory|. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working
-		directory of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is
-		ignored.
+		With no arguments, returns the name of the global working
+		directory. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working directory
+		of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is ignored.
 		Tabs and windows are identified by their respective numbers,
 		0 means current tab or window. Missing tab number implies 0.
 		Thus the following are equivalent: >vim
+		  getcwd()

comment_data.body: Thanks for the quick reply, you are correct, I misread some of the previous text, will fix asap.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3591,19 +3591,21 @@ getcursorcharpos([{winid}])                                 *getcursorcharpos()*
                   (`any`)
 
 getcwd([{winnr} [, {tabnr}]])                                         *getcwd()*
-		With no arguments, returns the name of the effective
-		|current-directory|. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working
-		directory of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is
-		ignored.
+		With no arguments, returns the name of the global working
+		directory. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working directory
+		of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is ignored.
 		Tabs and windows are identified by their respective numbers,
 		0 means current tab or window. Missing tab number implies 0.
 		Thus the following are equivalent: >vim
+		  getcwd()

comment_data.body: This is also wrong, as when 'autochdir' is in effect, `getcwd()` with no argument doesn't return the global working directory.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3591,10 +3591,9 @@ getcursorcharpos([{winid}])                                 *getcursorcharpos()*
                   (`any`)
 
 getcwd([{winnr} [, {tabnr}]])                                         *getcwd()*
-		With no arguments, returns the name of the effective
-		|current-directory|. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working
-		directory of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is
-		ignored.
+		With no arguments, returns the name of the global working
+		directory. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working directory

comment_data.body: I have fixed the mistake here. Apologies for the delay
comment_data.diff_hunk:

-		|current-directory|. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working
-		directory of that scope is returned, and 'autochdir' is
-		ignored.
+		With no arguments, returns the name of the global working
+		directory. With {winnr} or {tabnr} the working directory

comment_data.body:
this sentence is hard to understand. and has typos. here is a suggested update.  the "..." part is for you to fill out.

```suggestion
		Note: when {tabnr} is -1 Vim returns an empty string to signal "invalid", whereas Nvim returns ...
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3604,6 +3603,8 @@ getcwd([{winnr} [, {tabnr}]])                                         *getcwd()*
 		{winnr} can be the window number or the |window-ID|.
 		If both {winnr} and {tabnr} are -1 the global working
 		directory is returned.
+		Note Vim differs in its return value when {tabnr} is -1 it returns
+		an empty string is as it is invalid.

comment_data.body: I see what you mean, I'll make those changes later today. Not sure how I didn't notice the typos, thanks for the review
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3604,6 +3603,8 @@ getcwd([{winnr} [, {tabnr}]])                                         *getcwd()*
 		{winnr} can be the window number or the |window-ID|.
 		If both {winnr} and {tabnr} are -1 the global working
 		directory is returned.
+		Note Vim differs in its return value when {tabnr} is -1 it returns
+		an empty string is as it is invalid.

comment_data.body: Made the requisite changes, not sure if I over explained at the end but can change that if needs be.

comment_regular_data.body: Please do not exceed the line length limit ('textwidth' when editing the files).

> Please do not exceed the line length limit ('textwidth' when editing the files).

That is fixed now, I was writing them with the line about errors in mind, should have had the textwidth column on.

title: docs(vimfn): add more context to getcwd
